descp2: An optional `int`. Defaults to `65533`. The replacement character codepoint to be used in place of any invalid formatting in the input when `errors='replace'`. Any valid unicode codepoint may be used. The default value is the default unicode replacement character is 0xFFFD or U+65533.)Note that for UTF-8, passing a replacement character expressible in 1 byte, such as ' ', will preserve string alignment to the source since invalid bytes will be replaced with a 1-byte replacement. For UTF-16-BE and UTF-16-LE, any 1 or 2 byte replacement character will preserve byte alignment to the source.

An optional `int`. Defaults to `65533`. The replacement character codepoint to be used in place of any invalid formatting in the input when `errors='replace'`. Any valid unicode codepoint may be used. The default value is the default unicode replacement character is 0xFFFD or U+65533.)Note that for UTF-8, passing a replacement character expressible in 1 byte, such as ' ', will preserve string alignment to the source since invalid bytes will be replaced with a 1-byte replacement. For UTF-16-BE and UTF-16-LE, any 1 or 2 byte replacement character will preserve byte alignment to the source.
